post: A thriving democracy depends on citizens who understand their rights and responsibilities. The Bill of Rights Institute is dedicated to equipping students and educators with resources that foster constitutional knowledge, critical thinking, and civic engagement. The Institute provides free educational materials, student programs, and professional development for teachers, helping to cultivate the next generation of informed and active citizens. Their work is especially timely as we approach  #CivicLearningWeek, a national initiative that emphasizes the importance of civic education in strengthening democracy. Learn more about how partner organizations like the Bill of Rights Institute are advancing civic learning and engagement:  https://lnkd.in/eTsm2PJu

What does it mean to defend America's freedoms? In this episode of Honoring Service, CW5 Phyllis Wilson, MPA, BSN, RN Wilson joins BRI's Gerald Gangaram to reflect on her 37-year career in the Army, the connection between service and civic duty, and the responsibility of young people to lead by example. Wilson shares powerful stories of women in American history who fought for our nations principles, including those who served under General John J. Pershing in WWI, before women even had the right to vote. As president of the Military Women's Memorial, Wilson continues to honor the legacy of over 3 million women who have defended our nation. Watch to learn more about her story,  https://lnkd.in/eeK4qJEp.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #HonoringService

This  #WomensHistoryMonth, celebrate the women who helped shape our nation's history and championed the principles of liberty, justice, and equality. This month and always, we honor their legacy by providing resources that bring their stories to life in classrooms across the nation. Explore our Votes for Women curriculum which brings the story of the 19th Amendment to life today!  https://lnkd.in/eBHHuTVH.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #WomensHistoryMonth

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we proudly partner with companies that give back to civic education. When you shop using the designated promo codes, a portion of your purchase goes back to BRI. Shop Now: History By Mail - receive replicas of historical documents delivered to your door. Star Spangled Tea - Sip on history-inspired blends. Federal Flags, LLC - Get a flag today. Options include American, state, and even military flags! TravelingToGive - Support BRI in your travels! Visit  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C to shop! Interested in traveling? Visit  https://lnkd.in/epqqzbzz.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #AffiliateProgram

Find the Bill of Rights Institute Team at the SXSW EDU Conference March 3-5th. The South by Southwest EDU Conference and Festival empowers the community to advance teaching and learning as an international education conference. Attending the conference? You'll have the opportunity to meet Rachel Humphries D. Humphries, Senior Director of Civic Learning Initiatives, Derrick Anthony Reed, Director of Strategic Partnerships, and Emma Grahn, Senior Project Lead for Civic Learning Initiatives.

February is Black History Montha time to reflect on the profound contributions, achievements, and struggles of Black Americans throughout US history. At the Bill of Rights Institute, we honor the voices and stories that have shaped our nation's journey toward equality and justice. We provide educators and students with tools to explore the legacy of civil rights, activism, and leadership in America through resources like primary source documents, videos, and lesson plans. Discover our timeline to bring Black History Month into your classroom  https://lnkd.in/eMypMS7K

Pennsylvania educators, join us at the Middle States Council for the Social Studies Conference in Lancaster from February 28 to March 1! Explore free resources and strategies to bring civics and history to life in your classroom. Learn more,  https://lnkd.in/eKkSxNzF

Students, Teachers, and Parents! Are you looking for ways to find and earn scholarships? ScholarshipGPS can help! Scholarship GPS is an online platform that helps students and parents learn how to find and earn scholarships. David Peterson helped his son receive $95,000 in college scholarships. He started Scholarships GPS to help families navigate the world of scholarships to secure debt-free college degrees. Learn more, here  https://lnkd.in/eNehVDV5. The Bill of Rights Institute is grateful for Scholarship GPS's donation towards MyImpact Challenge. Interested in learning more about MyImpact Challenge? Visit  https://lnkd.in/gagj58zD.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #ScholarshipGPS

How do you create a lasting impact and action from a future generation of leaders? Bill of Rights Institute Vice President of Development Anthony Simone discusses how BRIs work in classrooms and communities teaches students to be responsible leaders. The Institute equips students with fundamental skills to become engaged citizens, valuable employees, and builders of their communities. Watch the video, "Creating Impact: What Happens When You Support BRI" now  https://lnkd.in/gME4_FqN. With the finest, free civics and history resources, educator professional development, and student programs promoting civic engagement and critical thinking, BRI equips the next generation with the skills they need to lead. Interested in supporting the Bill of Rights Institute? Visit  https://lnkd.in/g46izWV4 or contact Anthony Simone directly at asimone@mybri.org.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CreatingImpact

The Bill of Rights Institute is grateful for Presidents for Kids‘ generous donation to the Civics for Everyone initiative. Presidents For Kids is dedicated to making U. S. presidential history fun, accessible, and engaging for young learners. Through our magazine, we introduce kids to the leaders, events, and decisions that shaped America, helping them build a strong foundation in civics. By combining storytelling, activities, and trivia, we make history exciting while encouraging curiosity, critical thinking, and a deeper understanding of how government worksensuring civics is for everyone! Through the Civics for Everyone initiative, BRI is committed to the ongoing work of helping all students learn about our nations story, our government, and their rights and responsibilities as citizens. Learn more,  https://lnkd.in/eX8DHCFP.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicsforEveryone
